articles.description: Harry Kane scores two goals to help Bayern Munich overturn a first-leg deficit against Lazio and advance to the quarter-finals of the Champions League.
articles.title: Kane scores two as stylish Bayern beat Lazio

articles.description: Preview followed by live coverage of Tuesday's Champions League game between Real Sociedad and Paris Saint Germain.
articles.title: Real Sociedad v Paris Saint Germain

articles.description: Christian Meier rode as a domestique in all three Grand Tours - but locked down and retired, he found a new sporting obsession.
articles.title: Christian Meier: From Tour de France grinder to ultra-running winner

articles.description: Former Wimbledon champion Simona Halep is free to play again after a four-year doping ban was reduced to nine months.
articles.title: Simona Halep: Wimbledon champion ready to return to tennis 'invigorated'

articles.description: Kevin Sinfield believes it is "unfair" to say head coach Steve Borthwick is solely driven by data when preparing England for a Test match.
articles.title: 'Unfair' to say Borthwick only data driven - Sinfield

articles.description: Mohammed Ben Sulayem, president of Formula 1's governing body, allegedly told officials not to certify the Las Vegas circuit for its race last year.
articles.title: Mohammed Ben Sulayem: FIA president allegedly told officials not to certify Las Vegas GP

articles.description: Jamie Vardy's header gives Leicester a crucial win in the Championship title race as they beat Sunderland.
articles.title: Vardy gives Leicester vital win at Sunderland

articles.description: Leif Davis scores a late winner as Ipswich Town dramatically remain in the Championship's automatic promotion places with a 3-2 victory over Bristol City.
articles.title: Ipswich stay second after dramatic win over Bristol City

articles.description: Ben Stokes says his England team have "massively evolved" on the tour of India, despite losing the series.
articles.title: England have evolved despite series loss - Stokes

articles.description: Prolific Manchester City striker Erling Haaland says he can still improve despite scoring 80 goals in 84 appearances for the Treble winners.
articles.title: Man City forward Haaland eyes further improvement
